medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented to the clinic with a worsening eruption of innumerable pink-tan colored papules on his face, neck, upper portion of the chest, and upper portion of the back.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The lesions developed almost 20 years ago and have been rapidly increasing in number and severity over the past 3 years. The patient believed that the sebaceous neoplastic growth began soon after the resolution of his Stevens-Johnson syndrome in 1996. Associated pain and discomfort coincided with rapid lesion size increase when prednisone dosing was escalated.
medical_history.past_medical_history: 20-year history of Systemic Lupus Erythematosus (SLE) complicated by lupus cerebritis and anti-phospholipid syndrome; developed Stevens-Johnson syndrome in 1996 possibly in response to therapy for SLE.
medical_history.family_history: Noncontributory; no family history of colorectal cancer, hereditary non-polyposis colorectal cancer, or other familial cancer syndromes.
